tailscale.desc: $$$$Tailscale$$$$ makes the devices you own accessible anywhere in the world, securely and effortlessly. It enables encrypted point-to-point connections, which means only devices on your private network can communicate with each other. You can use it to access your devices or LAN remotely.
tailscale.need_login_tips: The Tailscale service is enabled, but the device is not bound yet. Please bind this device to your Tailscale account using $$$$The Device Bind Link$$$$.
tailscale.need_mandate_tips: This device is bound to Tailscale account, but has not yet been authorised for access to the network.Please go to $$$$ Tailscale Admin Console$$$$ to authorise the device to connect to your virtual network. If this is not your account, please unbind it first.
tailscale.enable_lan_tips: The device already allows Tailscale clients to access resources on the LAN or WAN. But you need to edit route settings in $$$$Tailscale Admin Console$$$$ for client requests to be forwarded to the device through Tailscale virtual network.
tailscale.ready_tips: The device is connected to your Tailscale virtual network.
tailscale.get_url_err_msg: Failed to get device binding link.
tailscale.allow_lan_tips: If this option is enabled, the resources inside the device LAN will be allowed to be accessed via the Tailscale virtual network.
tailscale.allow_wan_tips: If this option is enabled, the resources on the WAN side of the device will be allowed to be accessed via the Tailscale virtual network.
tailscale.exit_node_tips: If the export node you have selected is not available or cannot access Internet, the device will not be able to synchronise the settings to Tailscale.
tailscale.custom_exit_node_tips: If this option is enabled, the device will forward all requests to the exit node. Before enabled, you need to enable subnet routes {subnet} of this device in $$$$Tailscale Admin Console$$$$ for Tailscale to forward client requests; otherwise, your clients will not be able to access the Internet.
tailscale.current_ip_tips: Tailscale uses the 100.64.0.0/10 subnet, which may conflict with an ISP-assigned address or VPN client address. If your WAN IP or VPN IP is an address within this subnet, disable Tailscale to avoid being unable to network.
tailscale.custom_exit_node_warning: If you Custom Exit Node, the device will forward all requests to the exit node. Before enabled, you must enable subnet routes {subnet} of this device in $$$$Tailscale Admin Console$$$$ for Tailscale to forward client requests; otherwise, your clients will not be able to access the Internet.
tailscale.dns-warning-tips: 使用内网 IP 地址作为 DNS 时，警告用户可能会无法访问 DNS 服务器
